title: Piratapuyo (1993) Genesis Portion (Génesis)
description: Guanano (Wanano), or Piratapuyo, is a Tucanoan language spoken in the northwest part of Amazonas in Brazil and in Vaupés in Colombia. It is spoken by two peoples, the Wanano [es] and the Piratapuyo. They do not intermarry, but their speech is 75% lexically similar.
provider: Santafé de Bogotá: International Bible Society
